s.text: A commitment from European researchers to be engaged for the long term is essential for the success of these projects.
A commitment from European researchers to be engaged for the long term is essential for the success of these projects.
A commitment from European researchers to be engaged for the long term is essential for the success of these projects.
This might be a tall order, but it is essential if this worthwhile and high-profile project is to succeed.
This might be a tall order, but it is essential if this worthwhile and high-profile project is to succeed.
The EDCTP hopes to contribute to this essential endeavor by funding clinical trials that are sustainable in the long term.
In many ways the organization has a great deal going for it.
Doing clinical trials in Africa is far from easy.
And not-for-profit organizations that would like to partner with EDCTP have been left in the dark regarding whom to speak to at the organization.

However, the EDCTP Assembly, which contains a representative from each of 14 EU member states but none from African countries, has the power to veto the decisions of the Partnership Board, which is supposedly the scientific decision-making authority.
The EDCTP hoped to change that by having a Partnership Board that contains equal numbers of African and European representatives.
